title: Jurgen Klopp hailed as "fantastic" and "humble" after generous South African charity donation

Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has long been regarded as football's Mr Nice Guy - and he has further enhanced that reputation after donating £10,000 to a children's charity.

Klopp, who guided the Reds to a memorable Champions League triumph last season, recently made the generous donation to South African initiative - Joy is Round, which is run by Hout Bay United Football Community.

The Cape Town-based club, who run football teams for children aged seven to 18-years-old, oversee the initiative which aims to promote and raise funds for community football through the sale of balls and art, made from old clothing and other materials.

The German boss is a patron for the club and travelled over to Cape Town to see some of its members, along with people from the local community, back in 2017.

(Image: Hout Bay United)

It is understood that the former Borussia Dortmund head coach has maintained a close relationship with the charity after attending the event where 1000 people turned up to meet the charismatic manager.

Klopp's visit to Cape Town two years ago has only just emerged after a member of the club contacted the Liverpool Echo , with the manager hailed as "fantastic" and "humble".

Jeremy Elson, 42, co-founder of Hout Bay United, said: "Jurgen is a fantastic chap to have associated with the club.

"He came and did a talk in 2017, where he spoke about his time as a manager, his philosophy, football, his ambitions.

(Image: Hout Bay United)

(Image: Hout Bay United)

"He spoke for over two hours in total, everyone was captivated by him.

"The most amazing thing about him is how humble he is.

"He was really inspiring and he's just a really sharp, humble and engaging guy."

description: Klopp made the generous donation to the initiative - Joy is Round, run by Hout Bay United Football Community, in South Africa
